Record.ClassificationPath: Findings_and_Disorders_Kind/Disease, Disorder or Finding/Disease or Disorder/Disorder by Site/Head and Neck Disorder/Oral Disorder/Oral Cavity Disorder/Non-Neoplastic Oral Cavity Disorder/Non-Neoplastic Dental Disorder/Odontoma/Complex Odontoma
Record.Description: A benign, slow growing, and painless hamartomatous tumor occurring in tooth-bearing areas of the jaws. It is one of the most common odontogenic tumors and it usually affects children, adolescents, and young adults. It is characterized by the presence of enamel and dentin and the absence of tooth-like structures. It is treated with local excision. If it is incompletely removed, it may recur.
